Context:
Program Name: Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Electrician)
Code: B307
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Online
Duration: 5 semesters (with up to 8 years for completion part-time)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Centre: Business
School: Management
Location: St. James Campus
Program Description: This program is a tri-college collaboration between Algonquin College, George Brown College and Mohawk College. Graduates of the Electrician Certificate of Qualification program can enter the program in semester four and gain skills in business administration, management, accounting, project management, leadership, communication, and applied research competencies.
Contact Email: business@georgebrown.ca

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) degree program is a fully online degree-completion program delivered by Mohawk, Algonquin, and George Brown colleges. It builds on apprenticeship/journeyperson training or trade-related diploma programs.

The program prepares graduates for leadership roles in trades-related fields, such as business managers, project managers, quality control managers, maintenance and trades managers, and service-related managers. It also facilitates a pathway into graduate studies in business administration and management programs.

Students are required to complete a minimum of 420 hours (equivalent to 14 weeks) of paid co-op experience in a trades-related organization to enhance their professional development.

The program includes the following courses: 32 courses and 1 Integrated Experience are mandatory for degree completion. These include 24 mandatory courses and 8 Liberal Studies Electives of the student's choice.

Skills gained from this program include conducting research, using strategic planning techniques, developing marketing strategies, and applying financial information to strategic decision-making.

Graduates may choose self-employment as a small business owner or find leadership roles in various trades industries. Career options include: business managers, project managers, quality control managers, maintenance and trades managers, and service-related managers.

Context: The text provides information on a flexible degree program offered by George Brown College, focusing on functional business units in the trades industry. Students are expected to conduct research, deploy strategic planning techniques, apply project and risk management principles, identify opportunities and challenges, and comply with relevant laws and regulations. Tuition varies based on chosen courses and does not include books or additional supplies. Financial assistance is available through OSAP for eligible applicants. Admission requirements include a post-secondary transcript and departmental review. The program is approved for a seven-year term starting from December 21, 2020, with possible renewal. Eligible professions in the trades industry include Construction Electrician, Electric Motor System Technician, Industrial Electrician, and Powerline Technician. Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions. For more detailed information, applicants should contact the business department at business@georgebrown.ca or visit the transfer guide.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Electrician) Program B307 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
George Brown College will renew the consent for their program 12 months prior to its expiration. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. Information sessions are held regularly on campus. For inquiries about domestic admissions, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section. International students can contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry through the International Contact Us page. For financial inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section. To make an appointment with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options, please see their frequently asked questions. The Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) is offered through the School of Management located at the St. James Campus. For inquiries related to this program, contact Joyce Manu, Program Co-ordinator, at jmanu@georgebrown.ca.

Contact Information:
- Ontario Colleges Application
- Admissions Office: admissions@georgebrown.ca, visit the Admissions section

Context: The Bachelor's degree is offered through the School of Management located at George Brown College's St. James Campus at 200 King St. E., and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, ON, Canada. Campus tours can be booked and virtual tours are available on their website. Interested individuals can sign up to receive tailored resources for application processes and learn more about the college's programs and life at George Brown by providing their first name, last name, email address, and specifying whether they are domestic or international students from their country of residence.
